fields.description:
*Summary*
When trying to save an Announcement Banner using the word r(lower case) + a number, a error message is displayed instead of the Announcement Banner.
*Unable to render content due to system error: null*

!215145.png|thumbnail!

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Select Cog Icon > System
2. Under User Interface, select Announcement Banner.
3. Try to save the Announcement Banner using the word *r1*.

*Expected result:*
You would see the word *r1* as Announcement Banner.

*Actual Result:*
There is a error message *Unable to render content due to system error: null* instead of the word *r1* as Announcement Banner.
fields.summary: Error on save Announcement Banner.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As seen in the attached screenshot.

The problem is that the month is put with a capital letter: Nov and the back-end only accepts lowercase. :(

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your user locale to PT-BR
# Try to submit a date custom field by selecting any day of November

h3. Expected Results
Information should be saved as expected.

h3. Actual Results
The error message seen in the attachment is displayed.

h3.Workaround
Change the month manually to the lowercase version.
fields.summary: Date picker sets an invalid value that prevents issues from being created (locale specific)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Changing Assignee requires two clicks on the name and clicking it once will result to using the shortcut letters by mistake. 

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.217.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Issue View
# Assign the issue to a user
# Click the name of the assignee once 
# Input letter c to search

h3. Expected Results
# When assignee name is clicked once, it should search for users when you input letter c.

h3. Actual Results
* When assignee name is clicked once, and you input letter c to search for the name it will open the Create issue screen.
fields.summary: Changing Assignee requires two clicks on the name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The links generated to access the users profiles in JIRA are broken and pointing to the old usernames for renamed users.

So far we saw this happening in:
 - Release view
 - Team page on the Tempo Timesheets plugin

h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.784.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Kanban project
 # Created new user having username "User1"
 # Create a release
 # Add couple of issues to the release and assign them to "User1"
 # Change the username from "User1" to "NewUser2"
 # Re-index
 # Go back to the project releases section
 # Select the release to view (the one from step #3)
 # View the issues in the release list
 # Click on the user assigned to the issues

h3. Expected Results

The user profile page is opened
h3. Actual Results

The below error is returned:
 {{The specified user could not be found.}}

!Error-specified-user-not-found.png|thumbnail!

In the browser address bar you can see the url to the user profile is pointing to the old username:
 - [https://NAME.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=user1|https://name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=user1]

 

The link is created correctly if you open the issue and you click on the user in there.
h3.  
h3. Workaround

Replace the username in the url with the correct one.
 - [https://NAME.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=newuser2|https://name.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=newuser2]
fields.summary: Links to users profiles broken for renamed users (the old username is used in the url)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Clicking the Comment Link button or navigating to a JIRA Comment Permalink in Chrome does not Jump the Browser Window to the Comment

h3. Environment
* JIRA v7.2.0-OD-04
** Chrome (Version 49.0.2623.87 (64-bit))
** Safari (version 9.0.3 (11601.4.4))

Originally reported in:
* JIRA v7.1.0-OD-05-006
** Chrome 47.0.2526.111 (64-bit) and 48.0.2564.82 (64-bit)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# When viewing a JIRA Issue Comment, click the Comment Link Icon
or 
# Click a URL to a Permalinked JIRA Issue Comment
or
# Right Click > Copy & Paste JIRA Comment Permalink into the Address bar

h3. Expected Results
Page loads issue and jumps to the Permalinked comment

h3. Actual Results
Page refreshes to the top of the JIRA Issue.  If you scroll down into the comments, the linked comment is highlighted 
If the comment is contained within the Collapsed Comments section, the page does not load to the comment. 
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Firefox (version 44.0.2 and 45.0.1) appears to work
fields.summary: Permalinks to JIRA Comments Do Not Jump to Comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

_OAuth_ tab on Outgoing Authentication is empty if user doesn't have administrator access on both instances. This causes both instances are not connected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have 2 Cloud instances (A and B)
# in instance A, create an AppLink to instance B
# Click continue and uncheck {{I am an administrator on both instances}} option, Continue
# Pass {{reciprocal link}} to the Admin of instance B 
# Admin of instance B opens the link of different browser/PC, click Continue

h3. Actual Result

The AppLink in both instances are created with the following:
# instance A: Both Incoming and Outgoing Authentication are disabled (OAuth)
# Instance B: Incoming Authentication is enabled with {{Allow 2-Legged OAuth}} checked by default and Outgoing Authentication is disabled (OAuth)
# Outgoing Authentication (OAuth tab) on both instances show empty with below error on Network Console due to no one has Administrator access on both instances.
{noformat}
https://<instance A>/login?dest-url=https%3A%2F%2F<instance A>%2Fplugins%2Fservlet%2Fapplinks%2Fauth%2Fconf%2Foauth%2Fadd-consumer-by-url%2Fd0908deb-1227-3b26-bfe8-b9ac80781ecd%3Fuiposition%3Dremote%26hostUrl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252F<instance B>%26outgoing2LOEnabled%3Dtrue%26outgoing2LOiEnabled%3Dfalse%26oauth-outgoing-enabled%3Dtrue&permission-violation=true
{noformat}

h3. Expected Result

The AppLink in both instances are created with the following:
# instance A: Both Incoming and Outgoing Authentication are enabled (OAuth)
# Instance B: Both Incoming and Outgoing Authentication are enabled (OAuth)


h3. Workaround

# Have Administrator access on both Cloud instances 
# Login on both instances on the same browser and enable both Incoming and Outgoing Authentication
fields.summary: OAuth tab on Outgoing Authentication is empty if user doesn't have admin access on both instances

fields.description:
When transitioning issues, clicking the emoticons dropdown does not open the emoticons panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Click on a transition that required a comment.
# Click on the "Smiley Face" to open the emoticon panel

h3. Expected Results

All emoticons are displayed on dropdown panel.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
 
h3. Notes

When adding a comment to an issue without transitioning, the emoticon panel will be loaded out of place. 

 !Screen Shot 2016-06-02 at 09.49.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Manually add emoticons as per the [documentation|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=miscellaneous]

 !Screen Shot 2016-06-02 at 09.57.03.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Emoticons panel not loading correctly

h3. Notes + Workaround
The issue seems to happen when a project is imported from Trello, then removed and imported again. The root-cause is that the workflows created by the first import are not removed when the project is deleted. 

In order to be able to import the same project again you have to remove workflow(s) and workflow scheme(s) created by the first import.
fields.summary: Error in Trello Importer: java.lang.NullPointerException

fields.description:
The "Assignee" field renders incorrectly and only allows to select the current user if the screen also has "Version Picker" custom field.
Only happens if:
* the "Version Picker" is ordered higher than the "Assignee" in the screen and contains versions
* the screen is visualised from within another issue view (e.g: creating a subtask or a new issue while viewing another)

h3. Environment:
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-01

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Version Picker (single version) Custom Field
# Have Versions on a project
# Include the version picker and assignee field on the same screen: e.g: "Create Issue Screen"
# Place the Version Picker prior to the Assignee field in the Screen
# While viewing any issue, click "Create" and select the options to visualise the screen just configured.

*Expected Results:*
Assignee field appears normally and can be filled with a user.
*Actual Results:*
Assignee appears with a different layout being only a drop-down where it's not possible to enter a user name

 !Screen Shot 2015-12-10 at 17.31.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes:
Browser console logs the error:
{noformat}
Uncaught Cannot create CheckboxMultiSelect without multiple-select select element.
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
* Move the "Version Picker" custom field under the "Assignee" field in the Screen.
* Create an issue from the Dashboard or any other screen that is not the "View Issue" screen
fields.summary: Assignee field broken on screens with Version Picker custom field

fields.description:
Users are not able to load JIRA attachment, the page keep spinning There is a Javascript error on the console:
{noformat}
Error from console: 
Uncaught Error: jira/fileviewer/module-backend/asynchronous missing ajs
batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:9
{noformat}

The reason for this is disabled Hipchat for JIRA plugin - or rather the fact that we deployed code that depends on front end component ('ajs') provided by that plugin in other place (file viewer) - and because of that file preview doesn't work with disabled Hipchat for JIRA plugin (which users did disable in past manually, or got disabled by some-other-factor).

h3. Workaround

Load the attachment in a new tab or use the 'Download' Functionality. 

h3. Possible manual fix

For some instances it's possible to re-enable HipChat for JIRA plugin. But sometimes it won't start (due to dependencies).
fields.summary: Unable to load JIRA attachment

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms
# Time Report Gadget is showing "Gadget Error":
{quote}
This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.
{quote}
# Time Report Gadget cannot be found on *Add Gadget* screen.
 
h3. Notes
* Time Report Gadget cannot be found on *Add Gadget* screen seems to be related to [JRA-61560|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61560].
* XML link of Time Report Gadget has been changed:
** OLD: 
{noformat}
jira=# select * from portletconfiguration where portalpage = 11900;
  id   | portalpage | portlet_id | column_number | positionseq |                                                                  gadget_xml                                                                 
 | color  |                         dashboard_module_complete_key                          
-------+------------+------------+---------------+-------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-+--------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12805 |      11900 |            |             1 |           1 | rest/gadgets/1.0/g/jira-timesheet-plugin:timesheet-gadget/timesheet-gadget.xml                                                              
{noformat}
** NEW:
{noformat}
jira=# select * from portletconfiguration where portalpage = 11900;
  id   | portalpage | portlet_id | column_number | positionseq |                                                                  gadget_xml                                                                 
 | color  |                         dashboard_module_complete_key                          
-------+------------+------------+---------------+-------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-+--------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15103 |      11900 |            |             1 |           0 |                                                                                                                                             
 | color1 | com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:timereports__timereports-gadget
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
# Restart JIRA - if you are on Cloud log a ticket at https://support.atlassian.com to ask a Cloud Support Engineer to do this for you.
# *Remove* the existing Time Report Gadget, then *Add* a new one to update the XML link

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When attempting to load projects, access boards or access the Service Desk queue, certain projects return an error code 500 and a duplicate code error.

The errors are different for each instance  {{Duplicate key [14400]}} , {{Duplicate key [aparker]}}, {{Duplicate key [Version]}}.

h2.Investigation Done

Problem seems to happen to instances that have been updated recently and only happen to specific projects. 

Instance has issues with the duplicate key when opening specific boards and also when viewing a specific SD project queue.

AJAX error is also seen when the duplicate key error is returned.

{noformat}
ajax[64818760] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 500,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 64818760,
aborted     : undefined,
}
{noformat}

Even on the same instance, the duplicate key error is different. For example : 

When attempting to view Service Desk queues, the error below is returned.

h2.Workaround

Some instances of the problem are known to occur when JQL is used that contains duplicate values. For example, issuing the search {{fixVersion IN (1.0, 1.0)}} will trigger this problem. This will also impact Boards and Service Desk queues (as they base the issues returned on JQL searches).

A potential workaround (*NOTE: unconfirmed*) would be to ensure that your Board or Queue does not contain any JQL with duplicate values. Removing the duplicate should have no impact as it is redundant.
fields.summary: Getting Error Accessing Board, Projects and Service Desk Queue

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a new User with username "test1" via JIRA User Management page.
# Assign user to an issue. 
# Delete user via USER management
# Navigate to user assigned issue. The user name will appear in assignee with an x preceding the user name as inactive user should be. 
# Navigate and search for the user with the toggle for active and inactive users on the user management page. User does NOT show up. 
#  Run a select statement on both the cwd_user and app_user and the user exist in both tables in the JIRA database. User does not exist in Crowd in cwd_user. 
# Create Service Desk customer

*Expected Results*:
# User would not be able to deleted from user management as user is assigned to an issue. It should generate an error that the user still has associations. According to our documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/add-edit-and-remove-users-744721624.html the user should be deactivated and wouldn't be able to be deleted. 
# If the user is able to be deleted it should not exist in the database after deletion in JIRA. 

*Actual Results*:
The user data still exist in cwd_user and app_user and does not appear in the UI as inactive user though the assigned issue behavior of the user does seem still reflect the expected. This causes the inability to addd the user to service desk as a customer as an entry still exist for them in the database. 

*Notes*:
Previously, deleting users with issues wasn't possible. 

If you try to add the deleted user in service desk as a customer you will get a user not found as the still exist in the database. I recreated this issue in my test instance. I was able to re-add the user in the user management page. I then un-assigned the issue from the user and deleted the user in the user management page again. The user still remained in the database. I initiated a manual sync as well: <instanceurl>/plugins/servlet/embedded-crowd/directories/list and the user still existed in the database. 

I recreated the user and changed the e-mail address to attempt a work around for the service desk invite customer "user not found" issue (due to existing entry in the database). The e-mail change took affect in Crowd just fine. However in JIRA it created another user with the same username and a different -email address.
fields.summary: Deleted JIRA Cloud users can't be added as Service Desk customers

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using text formatting wiki renderer markup in a description or comment in JIRA, when it displays in the iOS app as the initial summary, it doesn't use the formatting.

However, when you click on the update, it will display the formatting.

h3. Environment
* 1000.319.1 JIRA Cloud
* JIRA iOS app version 1.9.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update a ticket using text formatting, e.g. color tags
# View the ticket on the iOS app. 
# Compare to the formatting when you open it.

h3. Expected Results
Formatting should be used all the way through, in the brief preview as well as the ticket view.

h3. Actual Results
Preview appearance:
!Screen Shot 2016-09-16 at 5.15.27 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 

How it would look when you open it:
 !IMG_1973.PNG|thumbnail!  

h3. Notes
The example above I didn't use as an opened case because black shows up... black. You can see in the 2nd example the colors DO show.

h3.Workaround
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Text formatting isn't used in preview of issues on iOS app

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the "Create Crucible Review Workflow Function" post function is added to a workflow transition, it's not possible to make the transition to this step any longer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a workflow and select one of its transitions
# Go to the Post Functions tab
# Click the Add post function link
# Select the Create Crucible Review Workflow Function and click the Add button
# Publish the workflow
# Go to an issue and make the transition to the one the above post function was added

h3. Expected Results
The issue transitions to the next status.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a Jira admin accesses the "Issue Types" administrative section, the "Related Schemes" column for a specific issue type may not list all the schemes that given issue type is associated to.

Also, Jira admins may also see the name of *contexts of custom fields* listed in the "Related Schemes" column. The reason for this is that Jira holds the issue type schemes and contexts of custom fields on the same database table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as a Jira admin into your Cloud instance
# Type the *g* key twice on your keyboard (gg) or, as alternative, your *period* key ( *.* ), then *Issue Types*;
# Find an Issue type associated to many issue type schemes.

h3. Expected Results
In the "Related Schemes" columns, Jira displays all issue type schemes that given Issue Types is associated to.

h3. Actual Results
There are missing issue type schemes in the "Related Schemes" for a given issue type.

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: While viewing the issue types, the "Related Schemes" column may not list all related schemes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When accessing a dashboard with gadgets that depends on filters that the user does not have access to, the error message is misleading and does not reflect the true nature of the problem:
{quote}*Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above.*
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a private (not shared) filter;
 # Add a *Pie Chart* gadget to a shared Dashboard;
 # Use the private filter on the *Pie Chart* gadget;
 # Access this dashboard as another user.

h3. Expected Results

An error mentioning the user is unable to view the filter or project would be displayed as in JIRA 6.3.15:
!jira6315.png!
h3. Actual Results

The following error is displayed:
!jira6411.png!
h3. Notes
 # The problem is simply that the user viewing the gadget does not have permission to view the filter.
 # The problem will happen if any field values was missing from the filter.

h3. Workaround
 * Note 1: Grant the user the necessary permission to view the filters used by the affected gadgets.
 * Note 2: Remove the missing field values from the filter.
fields.summary: Regression JRA-17411 - Misleading error when accessing Dashboards without permission to see gadgets' filters in JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Clone Issue succeeds, but it can take a few minutes to actually perform the operation.
h3. How to Replicate
 # Open any issue
 # Click on {{...}} > {{Clone}} > {{Create}}

h3. Analysis

The Clone Issue operation was recently change to use the asynchronous task framework, as such it can be queued behind other tasks such as mail handlers that take a non-trivial amount of time to complete.
fields.summary: JIRA takes a few minutes to clone an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transition webhooks are fired as "status name" while actually display the "step name".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook on a workflow transition.
# Rename the source and the destination status.
# Trigger the webhook

h3. Expected Results

The webhook fires the information as 

{"workflowId"=><ID>, "workflowName"=>"Workflow", "transitionId"=><ID>, "transitionName"=>"Transition Name", "from_status"=>"Source New Status Name", "to_status"=>"Destination New Status Name"}

h3. Actual Results

{"workflowId"=><ID>, "workflowName"=>"Workflow", "transitionId"=><ID>, "transitionName"=>"Transition Name", "from_status"=>"Source Old Status Name", "to_status"=>"Destination Old Status Name"}

h3. Notes

The reason why the webhook is fired with the old names is that despite saying "from_status and To_status" the webhooks actually fires the Step name instead.

h3.Workaround

Rename the step as well in order to match new status name.
fields.summary: Webhooks do not fire the status name properly

fields.description:

JIRA Cloud version 1000.552.6

# Once the files is attached refresh the page
# Click the attached CSV file

h3. Expected Results
The browser offers to download the file
h3. Actual Results
The browser renders the file and displays its content in the same window

h3. Notes
This behaviour is currently happening with .txt files as well, instead of downloading the file, they are rendered by the browser.

h3.Workaround
Right click the CSV file and select the option to "Save link as..."
fields.summary: CSV and TXT files attached to issues cannot be downloaded

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the customer request to get worklogs using REST API calls, the application timeouts due to its performance.

In both cases, the users are trying to get deleted worklogs using this endpoint:
{{/rest/api/2/worklog/deleted?since=timestamp}}

However, in both cases, it's failing with {{HTTP/1.1 504 Gateway Time-out.}}

Our natural suspicion is that for both cases, there were too many worklogs retrieved, causing a timeout.

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.789.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to access this in a browser after logging in (or use curl to do a GET request):
{{https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/worklog/deleted?since=timestamp}}
# It will time out, give a Page Unavailable and add 504 - Gateway Timeout

h3. Expected Results
The results must be displayed
h3. Actual Results
The application timeouts
 
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: JIRA Performance is bad to get deleted worklogs

fields.description:
Hi 

I used to attach my screen shot by copying and pasting the captured image in JIRA ticket directly (It even worked yesterday). This's really useful feature for developer if you fail a JIRA ticket. I won't be able to copy and paste any screen shot *when I edit the description field or add a comment today*. Is it *{color:red}BUG{color}*? Would it be possible to get addressed ASAP? Our QA/UAT/Client Service team use this feature frequently.  

*Note* - I can copy & paste the screen shot in JIRA ticket *while creating a new ticket*.

h2. Workaround

* Click on 'More' link in the issue 
* Select *Attach Files* (with capital F not small f)
* Right click and paste or cmd-v to paste the image
fields.summary: Cannot copy and paste my screen shot in JIRA ticket directly.

# Select *Kanban*/*Scrum*
# Check the option *Board from an existing project*

The board should be created

and

should be spelled properly with an S -- not a Z.
fields.summary: Rename classes to follow proper spelling

fields.description:
h2.Summary

Non default (application access) groups that are removed are still showing on permission schemes and workflow conditions.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a test group.
# Assign to a permission in a permission scheme.
# Remove the group from user management.
# Access the permission scheme again.

h2.Expected Results
Group is gone from the scheme. If a group is used as workflow conditions, it will also be removed when the group is deleted.

h2.Current Result
Group is still shown on the scheme. Workflow condition restrict transitions due to the non-existent group (deleted group).

h2.Note
Re-indexing and integrity checking is ran but the removed group is still showing.
fields.summary: Removed group are not properly updated in JIRA and still shows in schemes and workflow conditions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
From the latest band of upgrade, Tempo's Log Work button is disabled and greyed out on issues. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version {{7.2.0-OD-01-031}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access instance with Tempo enabled
# View an issue 

h3. Expected Results
The Tempo Log Work button to be clickable.

h3. Actual Results
The button is disabled or greyed out as per screenshot below:
 !logwork.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3.Workaround
Either of the following should work:
* Use the "w" keyboard shortcut and pop-up to log work would appear.
* Click the *More* button and select *Log Work* with the hover message "Log Work on this issue with Tempo". The pop-up to update log work should appear.
* Edit the issue for any field and the *Log Work* button will be displayed again.

h3.Notes
Currently this bug is being tracked by Tempo in their issue tracker here:
* https://tempoplugin.jira.com/browse/TT-2998
fields.summary: Tempo's Log Work button disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users are reporting some filter subscriptions are sending duplicate e-mails. This can happen if multiple subscriptions are set for the same time and the user is on multiple groups

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to the affected filter
# Select 15 minutes
# The notifications will be duplicate

h3. Expected Results
Send just 1 notification.

h3. Notes
Only happening to subscripts with Groups
Any filter with a Group Subscription

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Filter Subscription Sending Duplicate Emails (3 emails)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Generating a particularly large Tempo report can cause JIRA to OOME when it runs out of heap space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a particularly large instance with a lot of time reports over many years attempt to produce a report that spans a long time period.

h3. Expected Results

Report is produced, or error is thrown to tell you the report time frame is too large.

h3. Actual Results

The instance will run out of heap and stop responding or restart.
 
h3.Workaround

Generate many smaller reports rather than one big one.
fields.summary: A single request to Tempo is causing JIRA to run out of memory

fields.description:
The documentation on https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/latest/#api/2/board-getBoard is confusing in the way that it is using a SCRUM project key example and the endpoing is only for JIRA Core boards.

The confusion is caused by having the endpoint named *board*

*Please consider:*
* adding a comment to clarify this difference and avoid confusion with the Agile Boards https://docs.atlassian.com/greenhopper/REST/cloud/
* changing the example to a CORE project instead of SCRUM
* create a new type of error that mentions that the endpoint is being used to retrieve data from a JIRA Agile board instead of Core board. (see confusion caused on [JRA-60195|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60195] )
fields.summary: Documentation for Board REST API /rest/api/2/board/{boardId}/data needs clarification

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On IE11, when I try to add a user to a role and click on the textbox, the example text is not erased automatically and I have to manually delete it.

h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a project page.
# Go to Project Settings then *Users and roles*.
# Click on *add users to a role*
# Click in the text box and start typing anything.

h3. Expected Results
Upon entering text in the text box, the example text "Search by name or email" should disappear.

h3. Actual Results
The example text "Search by name or email" should disappear when entering text in the text box. 

h3.Workaround
Issue is not present while using another supported browser (Firefox or Chrome).

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to attach files in JIRA Issue, "Attachment thumbnail already stored" Error

h3. Environment
JIRA Core Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any Jira issue
# Click on browse a file and attach any filetype
# The upload will result in an error "Attachment thumbnail already stored"

h3. Expected Results
Attachment should be uploaded successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The Attachment upload will result in an error "Attachment thumbnail already stored"

h3. Notes
JIRA is trying to store the attachment using an existing attachment id from media_store_attachments

h3. Workaround
Contact Attlassian Support
fields.summary: Unable to attach files in JIRA Issue, "Attachment thumbnail already stored" Error

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions provides functionality to transition a linked issue as a post function on issue transition.

It is also possible to prevent a user from seeing a given transition on an issue, meaning that the transition can only be triggered by another workflow function. If this condition is enabled on an issue, then the post function to trigger this transition by JMWE no longer triggers this transition.

This problem would be seen by all users of a JIRA instance setup with projects transitioning linked issues in the described manner.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project where transitions cause transitions in linked issues via JMWE post function
# Disable the transition in the linked project from being instigated by the user

h3. Expected Results
The transition on the linked issue will happen.

h3. Actual Results
The transition on the linked issue does not happen.

h3.Workaround
Removing the condition on the transition that prevents the user from seeing it will allow the post function to trigger that transition.
fields.summary: JMWE transition linked issue does not work with transitions that are not user viewable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A JIRA backup with attachments fails with a Media API timeout and displays the following error:
{quote}
Read timed out
But don't worry, we'll fix it for you!
You just need to contact Atlassian support and paste in this error message, timestamp and your instance details.
Timestamp: 1480550135926
{quote}

In the background, the backup actually succeeds but users do not get the link to download the backup file.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud v

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Backup Manager
 # Tick option to Include attachments
 # Click on "Create Backup for Server"

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Backup completes and a link is displayed to download the full backup zip file.

h3. Actual Results
 !backup error.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/] to check the directory */data/jirastudio/jira/home/export* as the file is usually exported correctly to that location despite seeing the error.

fields.description:
h2. Expected Behavior
As a user, I should be able to reference a ticket when posting a comment by typing the full ticket number and should see the status of the ticket accurately reflect the status of the referenced ticket.

h2. Actual Behavior
As a user, when I reference a ticket while posting a comment, I see the referenced ticket and it's status, but the ticket status does not update when the referenced ticket is updated.

h2. Steps To Reproduce
# Create a ticket in JIRA. For example, say this ticket becomes TMP-001.
# Create a second ticket in JIRA. For example, say this ticket becomes TMP-002.
# Add a comment in ticket TMP-002 and include the string "TMP-001" in the comment.
# Save the comment and observe the ticket TMP-001 provides a single summary with a status of OPEN.
# Update ticket TMP-001 and transition to the In Progress state.
# Open ticket TMP-002 and review the comment made which references ticket TMP-001.
# Notice the status of the ticket is still Open and NOT In Progress.
# Add a second comment to ticket TMP-002 and include the string "TMP-001".
# Save the comment and observe the ticket TMP-001 provides a single summary with the status of OPEN, not In Progress to ticket TMP-001.

h2. Summary
When referencing a ticket in comments, the referenced ticket status should update when it is transitioned to a new state. Projects suffer when users are displayed an incorrect ticket status, which causes confusion to project managers, developers and product owners.
fields.summary: Ticket references in comments show the wrong ticket status on JIRA cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Similar to JRA-62859, when you try to escape an special character (in this case, the +), JIRA will ignore the search. For example, by using the following syntax:

 !Screen Shot 2017-01-18 at 4.57.33 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 It will display words with the "TEST STRING" text within them, but the purpose would be to retrieve only words including the +. In our example,"+ TEST STRING". 
 
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field Text with Multiple Lines
# Add data to field
# Go to the search of issue, in your JIRA instance.
# Try to use one of the syntaxes above

h3. Expected Results

JIRA will find the words using the + in from them.

h3. Actual Results

Depending on the syntax: The results will ignore words with +, and find all the words that have the same letters. 

h3. Workaround

There's no workaround for the operation.
fields.summary: Escaping +/- Do Not Retrieve Search Results in JQL
StartAt and maxResults parameters not taken into account when calling /rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/worklog endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When viewing an issue, clicking Tempo -> Tracker in the menu bar loads the Timesheets page, instead of opening the Tracker tool for that issue as expected if the URL is "pure".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue in a way that the URL bar shows only the "pure" link to the issue. Something like https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/XYZ-123
# Click _Tempo_ at the top bar then the option _Tracker_

h3. Expected Results
The _[Tempo Tracker|https://tempoplugin.jira.com/wiki/display/TEMPO/Tempo+Tracker]_ bar should appear at the bottom of the issue.
h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to the Timesheet screen.
 
h3. Notes
If instead of the "pure" URL the URL contains something else like a JQL, for example https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/XYZ-123?jql=id%20%3D%20XYZ-123, the tool works as expected,

h3.Workaround
Browse the issue through the Issue Navigator from a JQL, so the URL bar isn't "pure".
fields.summary: Tempo Tracker redirect to Timesheet screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the Issue search screen, we are not able to auto focus fields to select assignee, status, type or project. Although on the field "More" this is possible when you click on it, and that's exactly what we want for all fields.

h3. Environment

*Cloud environment
*JIRA Cloud Version: 7.1.0-OD-02-025 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open your JIRA Cloud instance, at the top open the "Search" menu and click on "search for issues"
# On the basic search click on assignee, status, type or project, the auto focus will not be active.

h3. Expected Results

Auto focus must be on the search field

h3. Actual Results

No auto focus on the search field, the only field that the auto focus works in on the "More" button.
 
h3. Notes
No Notes

h3.Workaround
The user must click on the search field, although this is causing trouble since there are hotkeys on JIRA, so the user press these keys without focusing on the search field and undesired actions are taken.

You can see the screenshot attached for more details.
fields.summary: Not able to auto focus on search field in JIRA Issues search fields to refine search

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After renaming the Transitions, the changes are not reflecting after published the draft.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud 1000.499.4

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Edit a workflow
# Rename the transition
# Publish Draft

h3. Expected Result
The transition buttons are renamed as in the workflow.

h3. Actual Result
The transition buttons remain as the old transition name.

h3. Notes
* The changes is applied when we view the Workflow from issue view
* Copied the Workflow and associate the issues with the copied Workflow, but it remains unchanged
* Delete the transition and re-create them, but it remains unchanged 
* Indexing does not help

h3. Workaround
The issue is caused by the *jira.i18n.title* property is not updated.
# On the workflow, switch to *Diagram* mode
# Choose the transition > *Properties*
# Rename *jira.i18n.title*
fields.summary: Transition Label is Not Updated After Publish Workflow

fields.description:
When customer generate a backup, the link to down backup file will no longer be there after a restart.

h2. Steps to Replicate

# Generate a backup and verified the link to backup is created
# Restart the instance
# Navigate back to backup manager and notice that the link is no longer visible

h2. Expected Result

On the top of the backup manager, we wrote a line:
{quote}
This backup file will replace the previous backup and will be automatically deleted after 7 days.
{quote}

It should be made available for 7 days if there are no further backup generated.

h2. Actual Result

The link is not available and there is no way to retrieve back the link apart from generating a new backup

h2. Use Case

For some customer's internal policy, they are required to take a periodical backup in case of disaster. Generating during the peak hours are not recommended since it might cause potential performance issue if the instance is huge. However, generating it after work expose to this bug (due to the daily maintenance). They have limited ways to reliably generate the backup.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud Link to Backup File Gone after Restart or Daily Maintenance

h3. Summary

We identified a dependency in JIRA Cloud between ScriptRunner and JMWE. Whenever we disabled the JMWE add-on, the {{Script Post-Function}} provided by {{ScripRunner}} fails and so does the transition.

We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file.
{code}

JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Subscribe to both ScriptRunner and JMWE in Cloud
# Add ScriptRunner's {{Script Post-Function}} to a transition

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Start an import process from a Redmine instance
# In the issue type mapping step, map one issue type as a "Subtask" for JIRA
# Finish the import

h3. Current behaviour

The issues will be imported and subtasks will be created without mapping the parent issues. So orphaned subtasks will be created in JIRA.

h3. Expected behaviour

Map the parent-subtask hierarchy from Redmine and automatically create the relationship.

fields.description:
I am using JIRA Cloud (JIRA v7.1.0-OD-02-030).  Oddly, that is in the "Unreleased Versions" of the Affects Version/s list.

While trying to resolve an issue, I found that the toggle from Edit mode to Preview did not function at all, even though I tried clicking on it multiple times.

Then I tried entering a normal comment in a JIRA issue.  The toggle worked to go from Edit mode into Preview mode.  But then it became somewhat stuck in Preview mode.  Clicking the Edit mode icon did not switch back.  However, after clicking the Edit mode icon several times it finally did revert back to Edit mode.  It seems probabilistic on whether it works or not.  (Also at times it seems as if it tries to go into Edit mode and immediately reverts back to Preview mode.  At other times there is no visible response at all to the click.)

This behavior is repeatable.

I also observe that when I mouse over the help icon, I get a mouse-over tool tip "Get local help about wiki markup help" and the browser (Chrome) identifies that there is an associated link.  However, when I mouse over the Preview mode icon next to it, there is no tool tip and no recognition by the browser of any link.  I do believe that in the past there used to at least be a tool tip message to indicate the distinction of going to Preview mode vs. going to Edit mode.  That should be restored as it was helpful to understand the function of the icon/button.
fields.summary: Toggle between comment Preview and Edit modes now unreliable in JIRA Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When filtering the issue by setting the resolution date to any date in March month, JIRA will throw an error indicate that the date format is incorrect.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud version 1000.5.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set system language as Deutsch
 # Go to issue navigator and choose {{basic search}}
 # click on {{More}} and type {{Resolution Date}}
 # From the Resolution Date field options, click on {{Between date and date}} and insert any date from March month
 # An error message will appear indicates that the date format is invalid even though it is correct

h3. Expected Results

Update the filter and return result successfully
h3. Actual Results

Throw below error in screenshot :-
 !Selection_131.png|thumbnail!
 Translation: Invalid date format. Enter a date of format 'd/MMM/yy'
h3. Workaround

Enable *English (United States)* for default language.

Another workaround is to use the JQL-view of the query-builder and use following JQL:
{code:java}
resolved >= 2016-03-27 AND resolved <= 2016-05-06{code}

Once you have entered this JQL input, you can switch back to 'Basic' mode and the search form will be correctly populated.
fields.summary: Resolution date field in issue navigator doesn't accept March month when using Deutsch system language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After logging work on a ticket in JIRA Software that has no 'Original Estimate' value, a user can go back and edit the 'Original Estimate' value. This in turn skews numbers within Agile reports for the project.


h3. Environment
Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Configure board to use 'Original Time Estimate' for 'Estimation Statistic'
# Tick the 'Remaining Estimate and Time Spent' for 'Time Tracking'
# Include 'Time Tracking' in Create | Edit | View screens
# Create a new sprint
# Create a new issue
# Leave 'Original Estimate' and 'Remaining Estimate' empty
# Add the new issue to the sprint you created
# Start the sprint
# View the 'Burndown Chart' report
# The 'Guideline' is flat
#* This should be expected
# Log work on the ticket created previously (More > Log Work)
# Input 5h for the 'Time Worked' value
# Edit the ticket


h3. Expected Results
The 'Original Estimate' field should be greyed out


h3. Actual Results
The 'Original Estimate' field is able to be edited

 
h3. Notes
Looking at this bug ticket:

*Can't edit original estimate*
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4888

It is stated: {{This is the designed functionality as being able to edit the original estimate would sway the timetracking statistics.}}
This does not appear to be what is happening here


h3.Workaround
# Remove all time estimation from the ticket on the 'Edit' screen 
# Save the ticket
# The 'Time Tracking' section will be removed
# Edit the ticket again and add the value the ticket should have originally been created with for'Original Estimate' and 'Remaining Estimate' (normally these will be the same)
- The 'Time Tracking' section should return as expected
- 'Estimated' should show the 'Original Estimate' value you input
- 'Remaining' should show the 'Remaining Estimate' value you input
- 'Logged' should show 0m
fields.summary: Original Estimate is able to be edited after work has been logged on a JIRA Software ticket / issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Timezone differences are not taken into account when importing a JIRA Server backup into Cloud. 
 JIRA backup doesn't seem to store the timezone in entities.xml (check 'Notes' below), so import may shift dates if they are interpreted incorrectly. This happens if the backup exported registered the dates using the timezone used in Jira Server (which seems to happen), while Jira Cloud interpreted as UTC. That makes the times and dates in the UI to be shifted as many hours as the time difference between the instances.

Affected dates are:
 # History dates (in 'all' tab in issue view)
 # Created date
 # Etc.

Apparently, dates like 'sprint start dates' are not affected, as they use a different data type. This is actually even worse because sprints and issues dates may become inconsistent (some are shifted and some are not), breaking reports.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Server in a specific timezone different than UTC (database timezone)
 # Create tickets and create history (by editing it, adding to sprints, etc.)
 # Migrate from this Server to Cloud
 # Change your profile timezone in both to match so you can compare

h3. Expected Results

The history dates, created dates, etc. are the same.
h3. Actual Results

The dates are not the same.
h3. Notes

In an actual test import, we could see, this was the date as retrieved using a 'select' in Jira Server (source) database:
{code:java}
2018-03-09 13:50:30.51-03
{code}
This was the data in Cloud (destination):
{code:java}
2018-03-09T13:50:30.51Z
{code}
This was what was registered in entities.xml:
{code:java}
<Issue id="10001" key="PROJ-2" [...] created="2018-03-09 13:50:30.51"  [...] />
{code}
No timezone was stored, so Jira Core interprets it as GMT (the Z at the end actually means GMT), though it should interpret as GMT-3 in this case.

After that, we opened the ticket in both source and destination, making sure the user timezone matched, and we could see this:
 !source.png|thumbnail!
 !destination.png|thumbnail!

There's a 3 hours difference. Though the ticket was created only 1 hour ealier, in the destination it says 4 hours ago (I hadn't even installed Jira 4 hours earlier). If we place the pointer over the date says {{09/Mar/18 1:50 PM}} in source Jira while destination says {{09/Mar/18 10:50 AM}}, though user timezone is the same in both instances (GMT-3).

Notice that this test was done with a recently installed Jira Server (with no advanced configuration) and only 1 project and 2 tickets (a very simple configuration). The destination Jira Cloud was a clean one.
h3. Workaround

Use either of the workarounds below, not both.
h4. 1) Edit the backup file (preferred)
 # Check the {{entities.xml}} file that was generated.
 # Look for lines that look like this:
{code:java}
<OSPropertyEntry id="10500" entityName="jira.properties" entityId="1" propertyKey="jvm.system.timezone" type="5"/>
<OSPropertyString id="10500" value="America/New_York"/>
{code}
 ** The IDs may be the different, but the 'propertyKey' is always going to be {{jvm.system.timezone}}, so you can search for it
 # If the file contains these lines, you shouldn't be impacted, as a fix was applied to take advantage of it
 # If it doesn't, add them next to other OSPropertyEntry and OSPropertyString respectively
 # Make sure the ID is not used by other {{OSPropertyEntry}} element. If it is, replace both ID (which must be identical) by another unused one.
# In the 'OSPropertyString' entry, make sure you change the value to the timezone from your source Jira.

h4. 2) Change DB Timezone

(!) {color:#d04437}This only works with PostgreSQL. If you use MySQL you will first need to export the backup and import it into a staging JIRA Server using PostgreSQL{color}. (!)
 *You may want to take a DB backup before trying this workaround.* 
 # Stop Jira Server
 # Change Jira Server timezone, by [Setting the timezone for the JAVA environment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/setting-the-timezone-for-the-java-environment-323392719.html] to UTC
 ** Alternatively, if the timezone parameter is not being used, you can change the timezone for the server (machine) running Jira Server to UTC
 # Start Jira (the {{User Timezone}} in System Information page must show the timezone change)
 ** Notice that this may change most users timezone as well, as Default User Timezone by defaults is set to the system timezone and all users that haven't set their own timezone will use it.
 # Generate a new backup and re-do the migration

For further details you can also refer to the below KB (for Jira Server):
 - [Incorrect Times Displayed in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/incorrect-times-displayed-in-jira-148078632.html]
fields.summary: Cloud import does not record entries timezone correctly (change items, issue created dates, etc.)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Autofocus to default field is broken on Assign and Close screens, which causes issues with users that are accustomed to working primarily with keyboard shortcuts. Currently only observed/replicated on Assign and Close screens.
h3. Environment
* Cloud JIRA v7.1.0-OD-01-053
* Autofocus works properly on previous v7.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue
# Click Assign button, or use {{a}} keyboard shortcut
# Assignee field is not focused

h3. Expected Results
The top field should be autofocused

h3. Actual Results
No field is focused, forcing a workaround

h3. Workaround
Use the mouse cursor to focus the desired field, or use Shift-Tab to get back to the desired field.

h3. Original Report:
It seems that your shortcut for assignee is not working as expected. When i click on shortcut *A* it does not automatically select the assignee field. I still have to manually click on the assignee field so i can type a name. Previously when i click on the shortcut it would automatically show the cursor inside the field and i can just simply type in a user. Please fix this issue. Thanks.

See this video: http://www.screencast.com/t/oXj0jNGX
fields.summary: Autofocus to default field is broken on Assign and Close screens

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Multi Line text field doesn't collapse when it's using the Wiki style renderer and have any kind of list

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Create a Multi line text field and add it to the default screens
# Edit this project's field configuration and change the renderer of this multi line text field from the Default text renderer to the Wiki style renderer
# Create an issue
# Populate this multi line text field with a list (bulleted list starting with '*', list item starting with '-', numbered list starting with '#')

h3. Expected Results
The content of the multi line text field can be collapsed.

h3. Actual Results
The "arrow" in front of the field's contents doesn't appear, making it impossible to collapse it.
 
h3. Notes
If you change the renderer of the field back to the Default text renderer and return to the issue you can see the field can be collapsed (if it has more than one line).

h3.Workaround
You could use the Default text renderer on this field since it can be collapsed.
fields.summary: Multi line text field doesn't collapse using Wiki style renderer and has a list

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When clicking on bulk change on a default filter such as [my open issue filter|https://rexsoftware.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=-1] and [Reported By Me|https://rexsoftware.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=-2] , the issue page just refreshed. In the log you'll see this WARN message:

{code}
2017-03-14 10:40:04.513297500 2017-03-14 10:40:04,512 http-nio-3008-exec-7 WARN test.user 640x1149x1  103.233.242.8 /secure/views/bulkedit/BulkEdit1!default.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.issue.bulkedit.BulkEdit1] Bulk edit bean unexpectedly null. Perhaps session was lost (e.g. when URL used is different to base URL in General Configuration)?
{code}

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test issue
# Go to [My Open Issue|https://afromustang.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=-1]
# Click ... > Bulk Change

h2. Expected Results
You'll get redirected to Bulk Operation page

h2. Actual Results
Page reloads

h2. Workaround
Create a custom filter for my open issue and reported by me filter and perform bulk change on that custom filter
fields.summary: Unable to perform bulk change on My Open Issue and Reported by Me filter

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Issue Type Sub-Task is not listed in the Issue Type when user try to create Sub-Task in Gadget.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Go to *Assigned to Me* gadget.
# Click on the (*...*) icon.
# Select Create Sub-Task.
# Sub-Task issue type is not listed.
# Creating Sub-Task is not a problem via the view Issue Screen

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, user can right click on 'create sub-task' link on the gadget and open it is a new tab.
fields.summary: Creating Sub-task from "Assigned to Me" gadget in Dashboard does not work
ServiceRocket's Salesforce Connector has broken association feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Icon of the issue types is displaying text rather than corresponding images in _Create Issuee_ screen and _Sub Task_

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* +Create Issue Screen+
*# Choose any project > Project Setting > Create
*# Issue Type: *Bug*
*# Next
*# !Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

* +Issue Type Screen+
*# Administration > Issues > Sub-tasks
*# !Screenshot2.jpeg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Icon of the issue types should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Texts are showing rather than corresponding images.
 
h3. Notes
* This does not affect create issue in pop-up screen, view issue screen and edit issue screen
* Issue types affected include: Task, Bug, New Feature, Improvement
* Issue types that are not affected: Story, Epic


h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Issue Type Icons Are Not Displaying Properly
